If you like coffee beers, I would suggest picking this up (or trading for it!)

12oz bottle courtesy of Guerde.  Pours a very dark brown with a one finger tan head that faded into a light film topper with some spotty lacing.  Nose is huge coffee and dark chocolate.  Taste is espresso, cocoa and roasted oats with a slight bitter hop finish.  Medium, creamy mouth feel.  Good stuff, especially if you like coffee.  Thanks Andy!

Crushed with Jakebra and Rybra at the brewery.  Coffee-ness.  Wow, coffee.  Not as much body as it should have, but so much coffee flavor and aroma.  And it’s alcoholic and beer, which is even better.  But if I seriously wanted alcohol and coffee, I’d take a shot of whiskey and chase it with some coffee, aight?

Great aroma of roasted coffee, softer chocolate sweetness, and maybe a touch of molasses. Pours black with a thin head. The flavor is nice and roasty upfront, like cold carbonated coffee, this is followed by silky flaked oats and chocolate sweetness, minimal amounts of dark fruit, and a little earth. Lingering dry roast, the mouthfeel is incredibly smooth and creamy with prickly carbonation. Really, really good.

Many thanks to iowaherkeye for hooking me up with this one.  Devil over a Barrel is an absolute favorite, so I was looking forward to trying this one.  12oz bottle poured into a tulip.

Pours dark, dark brown out of the bottle with a small off-white head that dissipates quickly to a ring.

The aroma is big on sweet dark malts and roasted coffee with some chocolate thrown in on top.  There are hints of dark fruit and molasses as well.

The taste is fairly sweet up front with some chocolate malts and that smooth oat flavor.  But the bitter coffee takes over after the sweetness leaving a lingering bitterness through the finish.  Complex and yummy.

The mouthfeel is off-the-charts creamy, like a dessert with good carbonation that coats the mouth in the coffee and malts.  Wonderful palate.

Bottle shared with alexsdad06. Pours clear dark brown color with a moderater frothy brown head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Heavy toasted dark chocolate and oatmeal aroma. Medium to full body with a thick smooth texture. Heavy chocolate bittersweet flavor with a medium to heavy coffee bittersweet finish of long duration. This is a standout porter.

Bottle.  Big thanks to Mes_and_Sim for this one.  Very deep brown.  Lots of camp coffee, powdery strong coffee and lots of oatmeal.  Quite oily in mouth.  Lots more coffee.  Not exactly subtle, just a temendous aroma.  Rest is pretty good, but the coffee just is too dominant.
Coffee ground richness, with just a little mocha.  Thick, frothy body.  Drinkable, but alcohol pounds you at the end.

A Mes rate: bottle thanks to Chad.Thick, balck and opaque with an attractive tan head. The aroma is exactly what you would expect. As Ian said very breakfasty. Full of black coffee and chewy oatmeal. Some lovely wooden notes underneath too. The oats make it so rich and thick. The flavour is almost identical. Slight hints of alcohol showing and the coffee and oatmeal really go hand in hand with each other. Slight barrelly notes and some huge chalky bitter chocolate. When it all comes together it gives it a bourbon character which I’m sure becomes pretty fierce in the Over A Barrel version. The finish is a big assault of everything all at one settling on some luscious and lengthy American chocolate. Strange mouthfeel. It seems a little thin at first but somehow becomes lavishly thick and creamy then ends really clean. Quite impressive. Lots to like in this one. Lovely stuff.

Thanks to decaturstevo for sharing this one.
Pours a fleeting tan head over a dark brown body.
Coffee, chocolate, alcohol aroma.
Sweet coffee and chocolate.
Rich and smooth. Very nice.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2010 Dark brown with ruby highlights and a thin tan head, quickly fading.  Aroma of heavy coffee which makes it smell a bit acidic.  Roasted malt, oatmeal and a touch of alcohol round out the nose portion.  Taste as expected is of heavy coffee, along with roasted malts, oatmeal, chocolate and a touch of caramel.  Body is smooth enough but the acidity on the finish is a bit too much.

(8-4-8-4-16)Dark brown with a medium brown head.  Aroma of coffee, oatmeal, roasted malt and chocolate.  Taste of coffee, roasted malt and fruit.  Creamy body leads way to a semi-dry fruity-coffee finish.  Very drinkable.

In short: A very good but very basic fruity porter.  Nothing new but a very good beer
How: Bottle 12oz from Ughsmash.  Thanks a lot Jason.  Drank when about 6 months old.
The look: Black body topped by a small but long lasting tan head leaving persistent lacings
In long: Nose has usual roastiness as well well as some dark fruit.  Nice mouthfeel, dry and roasted yet silky.  Taste is ok, burnt malts, a little roasted coffee beans, molasses and dark fruits.  Hopping lacks bite, the beer feels unbalanced.  This quite a few step down from tyranena other porter Devil Over A Barrel.  Still, this is quite a good beer.  nataS rof god ruoy lliK.

12oz Bottle. Smells like bad church coffee, chocolate liquor and brandy. A bit of fruitcake, sweetness and Christmas. Banana bread. Pours a reddish fringed deep mahogany and no head. Harsh, crashing acidic coffee through a thinner porter and cheap bourbon. Thin and washed out flavor. No chewiness or depth. Coffee overbears. Some alcoholic complexity. Flavor doesn’t linger. Palate is mediocre. Not well integrated flavor. Thanks Sean!

Sample at the Most Honorable SuperHappyFun Stout Tasting: YUM!  This is a great beer for people who like coffee beers!  Rich espresso, bitter chocolate, vanilla in the nose.  Flavor is very rich coffee notes, vanilla, and a sweet, then dry finish!
user_location: I F&ckin hate those guys from, Ohio, USA

text: bottle: pours black with a thin espresso brown head. aroma is spent coffee grinds, cocoa powder, small earthy grass and slight oat aroma. flavour is iced coffee, roasted grain, bitter chocoalte bar, mouthfeel is very smooth and a little of the oat comes out well, this beer is very easy to drink.

Hell yeah. HELL YEAH. Oily pour, scent of the greatest coffee or espresso I’ve ever had, with some vanilla. Amazing how it captures the smell of fresh ground coffee like that. Super smooth body. Some sourness and bitterness (orange rind?) in finish. Excellent.

I was a tad let down with this one. I think my hopes just got too high. Pours great, black with a big ol’ tan head. Lots of lacing. Slightly oily, if watery, on the palate. Aroma is cold coffee (not necessarily bad) Flavor is a nice mix between coffee and barley with notes of chocolate. Nice and silky. A little weak though, especially for a 99 percentile beer. Just nothing amazing, especially when compared to its big brother "Devil Over a Barrel"

Bottled sample via oakbluff. Near black in colour with medium carbonation. Aromas of coffee, dark chocolate, and a bit of red wine. Flavors are of cold coffee, vanilla, oatmeal, and hints of caramel and black pepper. Starts with a heavy-silky body, but dries out nicely. Well done.

The color was very black.  The head was creamy and dark tan.  The aroma was coffee, roasty, chocolate, and paper.  The flavor was coffee, sweet, roasty, hoppy, bitter/waxy, and alcohol.  The palate was full-bodied.  The finish was warm and waxy.

Sample at the Most Honorable SuperHappyFun Stout Tasting. Thanks to MIBRomeo for the trade! This brew is a dark brown color with touches of ruby around the edges. Medium and rocky light brown head that diminishes steadily, and stringy lacing. Lots of coffee in the nose along with some roasted malt and chocolate. Medium-bodied with a nice roasty character and flavors of coffee and malt backed up by some hops and chocolate. The finish is dry and roasty with a lingering coffee aftertaste. Overall this is an enjoyable Porter that I hope to try again some day.

This beer pours a deep black colour with a thin coffee coloured head. Intriquite lacing along the glass. Aromas of coffee or cappucino and heavily roasted coffee beans. Followed up by a certain degree of earthiness. Very rich and chocolatey, dark chocolate, dirt and oak tastes. A wickedly smooth taste but an overwhelming flavor that lingers on your palate for quite some time.

Thanks for sharing Yaniv!  Very dark brown to black wit ha dark tan head.  Big coffee flavor.  A bit older and acrider, but still nice and sweet with some chocolate.  Smooth and creamy body, with small bubbles and a bit viscous.  Big sweet malty chocolate over coffee and slight roasty bitterness.  Lingering fruity spice and coffee roast.  Not bad at all.  A lot like Founders Breakfast stout, though the coffee is more acrid and the body a bit more drinkable.

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2009 Bottle.  Its no devil over a barrel but this was a DAM GOOD porter.  Lots of coffee, liquorish, roasted malt.  Its creamy with a nice bitter finish. Oats and a fresh roast this is excellent.  4.0 then 4.3

Bottle. 
Pours a deep brown with a nice dark-tan head. Roasty, ashy aroma, some coffee, some smoke. Coffee milkshake flavor, again that ash but not overwhelmingly so, rich chocolate, malted milk, plenty of coffee.

Pretty good, but gimmicky (coffee milkshake overload).

From a trade with GrimReeser... Thanks, Chad! Tasty, coffee-laden porter with well-hidden strength. Dangerously quaffable. Pours an opaque, thick black with nice brown head. Smells of freshly ground coffee with notes of licorice and molasses. Flavor has a light sweetness carried on a relatively creamy mouthfeel, with dark coffee notes combining for a distinct impression of frappucino. Light bitterness seems to come from coffee and dark chocolate notes rather than hops, which is kind of pleasant. Some carbonation lightens the beer and interferes with the creaminess, just a tad. Very accessible and easy to drink. Smoooooov.

Thanks a ton iowaherkeye. Pours a dark brown brew that allows some light in the pour and sits black in the glass. Produces a one finger brown head. The nose isnt as upfront as I would have liked. Rich coffee, dark roasty, a little chocolate. The flavor is very nice big coffee, roasted, bakers chocolate, very little alcohol, very light waxyness. The palate is extremely full and smooth, oatmeal is doing its job. Finishes with nice rich coffee and a slight warmth.

Dark brown coloring, huge, rich, cocoa...its there in the nose, and its all over the flavor, this is Huge! 
Rich, thick, massive, monumentous...
Silky smooth, as they say...rich and tasty, thick and full, but not too much,...loads of malty promise hanging on the tongue...
massive, really. I write in my second sampling...thick with coffee..immense....magnificent. even from an utter sucker of the coffee porter/stout variety, this is astounding...hey, theres oatmeal, too!
Thick viscous pour.  Frothy tan head and decent lace.  Roasty aroma.  Coffee and chocolate upfront.  Malty finish.
20070630  12oz bottle.  Notes not really legible due to a spill on the page...full bodied, huge coffee but mild old coffee(?).  All about coffee - good if one dimensional...big porter.

Bouteille 12oz, courtoisie de Hogtownharry. De couleur brune très  foncée et opaque. Nez de malt ròti, de chocolat au lait (lactose), moyen de chocolat noir et de café, léger de houblon herbeux et avec des notes de vanille. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture riche et très crémeuse. Goût de chocolat au lait (moyennement lactique) accompagné dun léger goût de vanille et de crème ainsi que des petites notes fruitées (prunes) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute rapidement un goût moyennement amer de malt rôti (petites notes terreuses), moyen de chocolat noir et léger de mélasse sucrée puis en progressant vers la finale, un goût de café espresso vient se rajouter accompagné dun léger-moyen goût de houblon herbeux asséchant et de notes dalcool. Post-goût long et un peu sec, moyennement amer de rôti, de café, de houblon herbeux, moyen de chocolat et avec des petites notes dalcool doux et des traces de fruits (pelures de prunes).

Not quite what I was expecting with this one.  Moderatley watered down pour resulting in a dark brown amber edged pour, minor head.  Nose was light on everything...chocolate, coffee, roasted malt,  Same thing went for the flavor, great tastes were abound, but seemed subdued.

Honestly, I really wanted to share this with some friends from RateBeer - but the devil made me drink it... I really wanted to share the sight of his pitch black beer with the huge, creamy and lasting head - but the devil made me open and pour it... I really, really wanted to let other Ratebeerians enjoy the perfect aroma of coffee, roasted malt, chocolate and the light sweetness - but the devil made me enjoy it all alone... And I wish someone else but me could have tasted the smooth, slightly sweet and delicious flavour of coffee, light chocolate, roasted malt - but the devil made me drink it all alone... so no one but me enjoyed the incredibly nice, smooth and pleasant balance with the light roasted bitterness and the light pepper-bite in the long finish and cry out - YUMMMI - because the devil made me feast on it all by myself... Im truly sorry - but the devil made me do it.. - thanks After4ever/Tom - I really enjoyed this one, as you might have noticed :))

Bottle, dated 2 Feb. 2007, courtesy of wetherel. Pours black with slight amber at the edges and a very small beige head. I can smell some vanilla and espresso before I even lift the glass; when I get it to my nose, I get a seriously heavy molasses aroma, minimal chocolate, some ashiness, and a hint of an herb Im having trouble placing (sage?). The flavor has obvious coffee right off... a slightly tart roast, probably a Latin American bean. That is followed by molasses, wood, and prune. A tiny hint of vanilla bounces around once in a while. There is some herbal bitterness that dries out the finish, and gives it a little bit of a whisky impression. Pretty good beer.

Bottle 355ml?
Appearance:  Dark brown with reddish side, darker creamy head 3+Nose : Big acidic coffee nose with drying alcohol feel. Late fruity aromatic finish . Some earthy woody touches. 6+Flavor/Palate : Medium full bodied . Slight roast with some acidic coffee like hints. Roasted malt , INKA like.
12+/20

Bottled. Thanks to omhper. 
Black colour with low, brown head. Chili and coffee/espresso aroma. Not all malty in mouthfeel/flavour. Good chili-chocolate balance in flavour. Low bitterness. Great taste here!

Aroma is chocolate, tons of coffee and expresso, rich port blended with cocoa.  
Taste is cocoa, coffee, chocolate, mildness of coffee, but the presence of expresso.  Strangely drinkable, no hop aggressiveness, but it is present.  Smooth, oatmeal finish. 
Very, very nice.

12 oz bottle from Ughsmash.  Nearly black in color with dissipating light brown head.  Aroma is alot of earthy, roasty coffee as well as alot of chocoate, some molasses and light chalk.  Taste is no letdown with a plethora of coffee goodness, chocolate, and a nice amount of oatmeal.  Body is creamy and full for a porter, and a bit slick from the oats- Finishes with lingering coffee, chocolate, light chalk.  A touch of alcohol but otherwise well hidden.  great stuff.

3-8-08 bottle shared with lb4lb thanks to The_Epeeist! 

Rich black in color with thin watery tan head and nice spotted lacing.  Nice aroma of chocolate and roasted coffee.  When it first hits the tongue it is very sweet and then it finishes nicely with a dry chalky character.  Still sweet overall, but very drinkable.  Alcohol becomes somewhat present in the flavor as it warms a bit - but not too horrible.  Would like a bit more body and creaminess but overall, pretty darn good and drinkable.

Amazing. Courtesy of Ughsmash. Pours a dark brown with a creamy tan head. Aroma is mostly burnt coffee. Tastes of sweet oatmeal, coffee, roasted malts, some cocoa, and molasses. Palate is creamy and has a little alcohol presence. Love this beer.

Bottle courtesy of The_Epeeist
Pours black with a short lived light tan head.  Smell is strong sharp coffee.  Marshmallow and oatmeal in the nose too.  
Taste is coffee and oatmeal with some dark chocolate roastiness.  Body is medium with moderate carbonation.  Alcohol is hidden well.  Lasting bitter roast coffee flavor.  Nice flavorful cooffe beer with a noticeable oatmeal influence.  Very good beer.

Bottled (thanks omhper!). Deep rubyish brown colour with small brown head. Aroma is strong smoke, alcohol, vanilla, wood and a real boost of coffee. Coffee in flavour along with vanilla, roasted malts and some mild hoppyness. Long coffeeish aftertaste. Brutal, different and pleasant.

Bottled, thanks to omhper. Black with a  low brown head. Big coffee aroma with touches of oats, crackers and pepper in the aroma. Flavour is clearly dominated of coffee, dark chocolate and dark fudge with grassy hops and crackers In the background. Black coffee, oatmeal and cocoa in the somewhat one-dimensional long aftertaste. Quite unrefined.

Bottled, thanks cquiroga!  Pours oily dark black without forming any head. Loads of coffee up front. Sweet and thick, very malty, very roasty with massive amount of coffee. Creamy thick mouthfeel, coffee bean bitter finish. Certainly not shy, hardly refined. More a smack in the face of coffee. Certainly more interesting than balanced.

Bottle pours black with no head, just a small surface ring.  You can get a head out of this by spinning the beer around in a tulip.  It then produces a nice milk chocolate head that leaves lace spots.  The aroma is very roasted, almost charred, camp fire smoke, tobacco shop, bitter coffee, and bitter chocolate.  The flavor is coffee like, molasses, lactic, faint ale fruit characteristics, and obvious bitter chocolate.  The palate is velvet rich and coating.  There seems to be a lingering bitterness that does not distract - I am a coffee lover too.  More oatmeal characteristics as it warms.  Drink this cold to start, and take your time - as it warms you get so much more...  This is very good.

Bottle from Rileys. Pours a  deep dark black with a very obvious aroma of roasted malts rising up outta the glass.
Nice dark brown head that left a "got chocolate milk" mustache. Pretty complex, I mean, lets not kid each other, the deep roasted malts were clearly the winner here but the chocolate was also there. A nice beer and thick to boot.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2008 Bottled. Somehow, I got a weird oat and buttery funk on the aroma in this beer that didnt really please my nose. Flavor, on the other hand, was a real knock up in my rating. Still, silky pour with no head and barely any bubbles. Roasty milk chocolate aroma with lots of coffee and cream. Chewy palate that coats the tongue with malty mocha goodness and a lasting oatmeal presence with substantial hops to balance it out. Great mouthfeel!

Pours black, black, black with a dense HUGE head and cascades down into the body like Guinness, then lies still. Aromas of coffee are powerful. Maybe a little too much, but still delightful. Intense flavors of coffee, chocolate malts with just enough hops. Thick and rich is an understatement. This is like drinking a milkshake in a pint glass. Leaves you wanting another. This is one outstanding brew! Right up there with Founders Breakfast Stout as far as quality for the flavor profile.

Serving type: on-tap

Courtesy of Capt Cougar.  Poured an opague black body with a small tan head.  Aroma is very fresh coffee with some chocolate and mild cookie dough present.  Flavors are also uber fresh coffee with some nice, not overly bitter hops in the finish.

12 oz bottle shared with Axilla. thanks!. Poured opaque black with a slight tinge of amber and a thin tan head rimming the glass. Aroma primarily of fresh coffee. Taste is of coffee (not very roasty). The finish is crisp and dry, in fact it has a very woody dry mouth feel. Very nice porter.  I enjoyed it.

Thanks a lot for the bottle, Weepie. Black body with a tiny trace of ruby at the edge, but that is a narrow part of my tulip glass. A light brown head is fairly dense and faded to a thin covering, but stayed around. The aroma is peanut butter with some good milk chocolate. This also reminds me of a walk in humidor with its nice tobacco notes. The taste is lightly roasted coffee with some creamy balance. There is some dark chocolate and a little bit of bread crust. Nicely made and fairly well balanced. While you can tell this is a big beer, I would not have guessed the abv to be this high. Another winner from Tyranea and a fine choice for rating 3,000.

Black body light brown head;  Very pleasant and well made smooth coffee nose; Balanced bitter fresh body, smooth with a bitter bit, superb balance and very pleasant; great finish evolving perfectly balanced, smooth with very fitting aromas. Great porter, long time since I had a "black" beer this drinkable.

12 oz bottle, bottling date 02FEB07, courtesy of Soonah, who is da MAN. Part of the "BREWERS GONE WILD!" series, which always evokes images of men in breweries lifting their shirts and howling for a camera... LOL. Anyway, pours black with a brown head. Massive, slightly burnt, fresh ground coffee bean nose, chocolaty with something like a chocolate chip cookie dough aroma. Sweet coffee flavors, like someone put about a teaspoon too much sugar into your cuppa joe (at least for my coffee). Roasty and chocolaty, a hint of dough. Silky mouthfeel, just slightly more than medium body. Rich, but easy to drink. Sweetness hangs with you through the finish. Nice!

Bottle.  Pours black with very little light brown to no head.  Aroma is big time fresh coffee grounds, a little hint of molasses.  Taste big on the coffee, but more chocolate comes forward in the taste.  Silky smooth, gets a little chalky as it warms.  Great brew for the coffee lover.

[1018-20071231] Bottle (c/o HogTownHarry, w/ jerc). Coffee hints and sweet roasted malt aroma. Dark black brown body with a quick foamy tan head. A little boozy, flavour is sweet dark roasty malt and a bit of fruit notes. Medium-full body. Nice but bitterness could be smoother.

12 oz from a trade with ughsmash. pours very dark brown with a tan head that is gone before the first sip. aromas are of chocolate covered esspresso bean. flavours are initially coffee which fades to a sweet chocolate finish. very well crafted. a could drink a pile of this stuff.

Poured a semi-viscous dark brown with virtually no head.  A tight, thin ring of lacing maintained for a while with spots of lacing.  The aroma was baking chocolate, light smoke, some coffee and even some earthy dryness, perhaps it was the oatmeal?  The flavor had a pronounced lean towards the dry oatmeal and coffee, with the chocolate popping in occassionally to say hi.  The mouthfeel was nice enough but overall this beer doesnt keep pace with something like Breakfast Stout.  Above average, not great.

The body is a thick, dark chocolate brown.  A small, foamy tan head settles quickly to a thin film with a prominent edge.  Minimal, spotty, sudsy lacing noted.  The aroma shows rich, roasty coffee with cream, accompanied by chocolate malts and moderate, earthy hop bitterness.  The flavor follows suit, with coffee being the star attraction.  Im not a coffee lover, but this is an awesome brew.  Theres just enough chocolate sweetness to balance out the intensely roasty coffee profile.  The oatmeal element adds incredible smoothness and drinkability.  The medium-full mouthfeel is just a little over carbonated, with fizzy bubbles intensifying the bitter coffee finish.  Reminds me alot of Terrapin Wake-N-Bake, though note quite as huge.  Very solid brew.  Worthy of its lofty rating.

12-oz. Black. Huge, thick, surging, moussy tan head that falls quickly away to nothing--no head or lace. Ginormous coffee nose with soft sweet oats. Medium body: soft and silky, just as the label describes. Rich coffee flavors go nuts from the attack through the mid-palate and long into the finish. Delicious. They really nailed that coffee flavor.

Bottle courtesy after4ever. Ive been impressed with the "Brewers Gone Wild" series, and really, where else are you going to find a Imperial Oatmeal Coffee Porter? Pours opaque blackish brown with a lacy, thick and fluffy tan head. Aroma of brewed coffee. Creamy medium body. Sweet coffee and brown sugar taste. Dry and slightly sour espresso finish.

Bottle courtesy of HogTownHarry. Black body with a small tan head that fades. (3+) Dry mocha aroma, roast. (6+) Dry roasty, moderately dilute roast coffee flavour. Average palate is a touch under carbonated for my liking. Decent but the coffee profile is just not for me.

Bottle. 
Pours a pitch black body with a medium-sized brown-mocha head.
The aroma is dominated by sweet raw coffee along with hints of vanilla and caramel. The taste brought on another dimension that seems a bit more complex than the aroma would have you believe. The palate is delectably rich and smooth. Layered chocolate, coffee and soft oatmeal flavours. Very nice!
Thanks for the bottle, Harry.

Bottle shared with tupalev. My bottle, obtained from HogTownHarry. Deep almost-black colour with a wispy brown head. Aroma is sweet, with the expected coffee notes, but fairly subdued. Medium bodied. Flavour is roasty, with the coffee and dark malt in good balance. As tupalev notes, I think this suffered in comparison to the Bells Java Stout - it was good, but not the WOW beer that others are finding it to be.

Bottle, shared with and courtesy of GregClow.  Pitch black, small swirly brown head.  Aroma - muted -some sweetness.  Tate - again, muted.  Dry oatmeal, some alcohol, some sweetness.  The whole thing is solid but sort of quiet and really suffers from coming directly after Bells Java in our mini-tasting. I had no idea it was rated so highly.

Pours an opaque black with a brown hue. Small cocoa head that dies to a ring with small lacing. Smells of delicious roasted coffee, bam. I love it. Better than I could hope for. Tastes of expresso, molasses and a hint of chocolate malt. Creamy, full mouthfeel, very smooth. Great drinkability. This was an absolute joy to sip on and a tip top representative of the style.

From trade with Pantanap - Thanks bud!  Pours a deep red/brown with a thin dark tan head.  Aroma is smooth coffee and relatively strong on milk chocolate; some underlying roasted malt aroma as well...damn fine nose!    Flavor is roasted coffee (not burnt), chocolate, some brown sugar, and a bit of dark fruit near the end.  The finish is somewhat bitter, but not overly so.  Extremely easy to drink and smooth on the palate.  Couldnt help but think that this acted like a light imperial stout.  Great first experience with Tyranena Brewing!
This was not a bad porter,it  had hints of coffee and very roasty but not overwhelming.hints of chocolate with a smooth and silky finnish.CHEERS!

Medium statured head, retention is good with solid lacing. An almost black brew, ruby edging. Nose is  big coffee, roast and chocolate.  Body is med/full, oily, coating and silky on the palate, very nice mouthfeel. Flavors follow suit with the aroma and are very well balanced. Some berryish notes evolve as it warms. Dry, roasty finish with an aspiriny bite. Another fine product form the folks at Tyranena. Thanks for sharing eaglefan! Thanks to CaptainCougar for hooking me up with a bottle also! Thanks Tom!

Bottle from Bockyhorsey. Pour was full deep black-brown, very nice slowly developing head settled to the top, nice in size, great retention, wonderful lacing. The aroma was a full and robust coffee with some supporting chocolate, dry roastiness. The flavor was outstanding, top notch among its coffee stout or porter peers, nearly perfect coffee flavors melded with a light chocolate underneath, very detectable dry oatmeal too with some breadiness underneath. The mouthfeel was incredible, silky smooth, wonderful dryness to make this one of the best balanced full coffee brews Ive had, the farthest thing from sticky, yet a bold brew. Great job, Tyranena, and a super duper thanks to Bill and Wendy for this selection, simply outstanding!

Thanx to Fantomas for this.Straight up coffe with small amounts of sugar in it on the nose.A dark brown pour with a tan thin lacing head.Coffee, very little bitterness, medium mouthfeel.Flavor was spot on coffee with a small coffee finish.

12-oz bottle received via trade with jrob_21.  Pours opaque like coffee left in a heated pot for days but with a thinner consistency, small, fizzy, dark brown head, diminishing with spare lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (dark roasted coffee, nutty, bread), light hops (grass), average yeast (leather) with notes of tar, charcoal, and fresh dark roasted coffee beans.  Full bodied, silky texture, average carbonation, probably subdued somewhat by the silky texture, finish is creamy with a tinge of bitterness.  Long duration yet without the coffee breath that would accompany an equally strong cup of coffee, light sweetness, moderate acidity and bitterness, finishes a tad dry and roasted.

12oz from pantanap - thanks, Kan! A nice goopy looking pour, minimal head and carbonation (except for traces of cappuccino lacing). A full aroma, with lots of bready and chocolate notes in with the coffee. The taste is far smoother and creamier (oatmeal, baby!) than some of the more aggressive coffee brews. A lovely, near-sweet flavor with a tad of vanilla is detectable and adds balance to the robust beer. Another excellent entry in the Brewers Gone Wild series!

(Bottle)  Pours a opaque black body with an average creamy tan head.  Aroma of strong coffee beans, roastiness, and hint of burnt.  Flavor of expresso and roasted malt.  The coffee characteristics are bit overdone.
Very dark chocolate pour with almost no head, plenty of roast coffee and chocolate flavor with a lighter body for the style, finishes pretty clean.  Good beer, Id like more.
Bottled. A black beer with a rim of brown head. The aroma is sweet malty with some notes of soy sauce, roasted malt, and alcohol. The flavor is sweet with strong notes of roasted malt.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2015 12oz bottle.  Near-perfect espresso roast nose, with heavy chocolate, very fresh overall.  Texture is a little thinner than I think would be perfect for a beer like this, but its at least creamy and rich.  Along with the chocolate and coffee, some cherries show up, very faint like, but more noticeable in the finish, which turns slightly sweet.  Overall a fantastic beer.  Rich, lightly sweet, and with low hop presence (how I like em).
Dark brown colour with a tan head. Roasted, coffee bitter aroma with a light chocolate and fruity sweetness. Roasted malty flavor with a coffee bitterness and notes of fruit.

Thanks to CaptainCougar for this bottle.  Pours black with a small but long lasting tan head.  Nice lacing.  Aroma is heavy on the coffee, but its appealing in its nuttiness and earth.  Some light chocolate and leaves in the background.  Tastes of dark chocolate, similar deep nutty coffee, and a pleasant mild acidity or astringency.  Finishes similar to the flavor but woodier, and coats the throat in flavor.  This beer has a slight grit to the texture in my opinion and feels full to the mouth, yet light on the tongue.  Very creamy.  A bit simple, but this is well done and these sort of flavors just cant go wrong to me.

Bottle.  Thanks Buckybeer!  Pours a dark black with a thin brown head.  The aroma has a lot of coffee, chocolate and roasted malts.  Robust flavors, full with coffee, and malts, with a hint of cocoa.  Full finish.  Damn well made beer.  They are making a believer out of me

12 oz bottle.  Chocolate color with no head.  Dark and opaque with a hint of brown fuzz.  The aroma is slightly chalky with dark chocolate and coffee.  The flavor is roasted coffee bean, roasted grain, Kailua, and dry unsweet coco.  Do I note a hint of lactose?  This is everything my wife hates about a beer.  I on the other hand enjoy it.  Medium body and the mouth feel is kind of wet.  A good brew.

Bottle: Dark coffee, black, nice brown light head and lacing. Nose of starchy coffee, vegetal maple and soy sauce, nice chocolate and corn. The flavor is vegetal. Sweet, clean, lots of coffee finish. Nice porter.

Autumn Brew Review 07  
Pours a dark brown with a tan head.  Roasted nut flavor with chocolate and oatmeal, making this a smooth easy to drink beer.  ABV hardly noticed.  Pretty solid higher strength porter.

Bottle from Secret Santa, 07/26/07.  Small head consisting of quick fading very small bubbles.  Dark black brown liquid.  Aroma of coffee maybe a bit dry smell.  Body looks medium to think on swirl.  Taste is a nice kind of mellow.  With this smell, I sometimes predict a hard dry bitterness to follow in the taste.  It is still dry, but not bitter  A little bit husky.  No acidity.  Pretty easy to drink.  Not my favorite style (I have a big sweet tooth), but well done nonetheless.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2008 Pours a dark dark brown with a thin tan head. Aroma of coffee, roasted malt, and chocolate. Coffee aroma becomes much stronger as it warms. Body seems a little thin. Update - retried less coffee, more sweet chocolate. Sweeter. Alcohol seems to come out a little, must have been covered up by the coffee before. Like it much more.

Bottle (trade with KingpinIPA).  Smoky coffee and chocolate aroma - mouthwateringly good.  Dark black-brown color with small head.  Strong coffee, chocolate and oatmeal flavors - light astringency.  Moderate carbonation and acidity.  A marriage of coffee and beer - spectacular.

Bottle thanks to Drewbeerme - Nearly black in color with a fading tan head.  Aroma is big with lots of fresh coffee, some chocolate, and maybe some cinnamon?  Detecting some spicy-sweetness in there.  Flavor is a great mix of sweet and strong coffee, dark chocolate, roasty-sweet malts, oats, and more coffee.  Very smooth.  Could be thicker, but its hard to complain when a beer is this tasty!

And the guys from Tyranena score a hat trick!! My third time with this brewers and damn if they didnt make another outstanding beer. The beer pours out into my Maudite glass a black coffee color with a dark chocolate brown highlight. Very little head on this beer, only a small ring of foam. Aroma is rich with freshly roasted coffee, light ash, and molasses. Mouthfeel is supple, like a lamb skin jacket, with enough creamyness to be extraordinary. Flavor is a fantastic combonation of fresh coffee, dark chocolate, and sweet oats. A really outstanding beer that blurs the lines of a porter and a stout.

12 oz bottle obtained via trade.  Dark black pour with virtually no head.  Very light carbonation.  Aroma of coffee and dark malts.  Flavor is much of the same, coffee, coffee and malt.   Totally enjoyable though.  Palate is velvety and smooth.  Very nice.

(bottle, thanks JK) Pours black with a dark tan head.  Aroma is one dimensional, but contains a really nice smell of roasted coffee, with just a slight bit of hops.  Flavor is also a blast of coffee with a nice roasted finish.  A bit thin though.
[Bottle, thanks JK] Pours black with a dark tan head.  Aroma is just a blast of coffee.  Taste is the same.  Too thin--weak point of the beer.  Very one-sided beer, decent for what it is though.

Thanks to my Secret Santa, BBB63. Pours black with a small beige, foamy head. Smells a bit of olives(?) and coffee. Quite sweet, with mild aromas of toasted malts, burnt malts and scorched malts. Also lots of toasted coffee with tiny hints of rhum(?). Medium to full bodied. Medium carbonation. Long toasted finish with some coffee. Nice.

Date: 04/21/2007
Mode: Bottle
Source: Tasting, 50 More Beers on the Wall

black, wispy tan head, drops of lace, big roasted and coffee aroma, creamy body, rich coffee flavor, the creamy oatmeal body goes well with the coffee, a touch of roasted tartness, 
-------- />
Date: 04/22/2007
Mode: bottle
Source: trade

streaks of lace, coffee aroma remains strong and begins to pick up an ashy component, the creamy coffee flavor still overcomes the ashy character, the chocolate from the underlying porter finally comes through after much warming, 

Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 8/10; Overall: 14/20
Rating: 3.6/5.0Drinkability: 7/10
Score: **4
Pours black with a dark tan head.  Aroma of coffee and roasted malts.  More coffee in the taste.  Some bitter chocolate also.

#1300 - 12 oz  Dense used motor oil black, thick dark tan creamy head.  Intense warm and wet espresso grounds aromatics are well entrenched within the realm of toasted black chocolate notes, vanilla cream puffs, and hints of black licorice Twizzlers.  Black coffee bitterness balances very well on charred chocolate tones from start to finish.  Medium bodied, medium carbonation, dry, bitter coffee finish.  Love Italian or French roast coffee = love this beer

Bottle from pantanap (thanks!).  Poured black with no head.  Immediate aroma of roasty coffee.  Cant really pick out much else though.  Taste is pretty much the same.  Big time coffee taste, but not to the point of being too aggressive or overdone. Very smooth texture on the palate, but becomes a little watery later. Even more roastiness comes out in the finish.  Practically no carbonation to speak of.  A good coffee brew to be sure, but just short of great.

No head from a somewhat high pour.  Minimal carnbonation.  Thin wisp of bubbles is all that is there. Color is essentially black with a bit of reddish brown around the edges.  Big roasty and bitter coffee aroma.  Dusty and dry smelling.  Bit of dark fruit in there also.  Rich and roasty with lots more coffee flavor.  No as much as I expected though which is good because I think that too much coffee in a beer just overpowers everything else and detracts from the overall flavor.  More dark fruit and sweet caramel malts.  Creamy smooth texture.  Finish is sweet and smooth and malty with only a lingering hint of coffee.  This is the way I like my coffee beers.  Just a light touch.  Fanastic balance in this brew.  Was not real hopeful in the begining but this brew came through big time in the end.

(Bottle) Via trade with Ughsmash. Sampled at Ciderwinder 4. Pours a thin, yellow dissipated head with an opaque body. Nose of molasses, vanilla, marshmellow, whiskey and coffee. A tad thin in texture, good mid-palate of coffee. A bit weak but well pronounced in the coffee realm. Thanks Jason!

Bottle into stemmed glass.  Purchased at Discount Liquor, Milwaukee.  Pretty durn good.  I usually dont like oatmeal as an ingredient, but its musty funk is counterbalanced here by the "imperial" and coffee aspects, which are easily discernable.  The oatmeal comes out first in the aroma a bit, which also belies the chocolate.  The oatmeal helps warm the usually cold slab of chocolate sweetness in imperial porters.  The feel is a bit watery near the finish.  Its a good bundle of flavors, but it didnt overly impress.

(Bottle via trade with <A HREF=http://www.ratebeer.com/ViewUser.asp?UserID=2 target=blank>CaptainCougar, thanks Tom!) Grassy as heck...Pours very dark brown with surprisingly very little head. Aroma of fresh roasted coffee and some dark sweet chocolate. Mouthfeel kind of loose and thinnish, lightly fizzy, very lightly oily (not the oatmeal silkiness as described on label). Flavor is, whoa!, very grassy upfront and straight through finish. Once I got past the grassiness there was fairly nice bitter coffee roast flavor but nothing really exceptional. Very little complexity. Bitter lingering coffee aftertaste. Not too good.

Very raw beany nose jumps out of the glass.  Dark brown, somewhat hazy.  The aroma also shows pungent dark chocolate and cookie dough sweetness.  Flavour is sweet, with abundant somewhat harsh coffee that is rather abrasive on the tongue.  The big malts provide a certain cushion for the harsh, unpleasant vegetal roastiness.

12 oz bottle from Milwaukee.  Black opaque color with no head when poured but when swirled picks up a med. brown head that fades to small off-white.  Aroma of pure coffee with a little chocolate and roasted malt.  That same strong flavor is in the flavor with sweet malt, alc, some dark cherries, roasted but very sweet malt.  Med to light body, with no carb and creamy.  Very sweet and underwhelming.  Overall sweet caramel coffee that is very drinkable.

Pours like coffee, smells like coffee--enough that it woke me up after a hard day!  Oil black with a thick but dissipating tan head. Thick and full-bodied on the tongue with a coffee bitterness. Coffee flavor almost (but not quite) overwhelms oatmeal flavors. This is thick and creamy and delicious. The finish is very smooth. Porters dont get much better than this!

Bottle thanks to the special Ross. And by special, I mean retarded. Pours an oil black with frothy brown head. Aroma is packed full of dry roast coffee and burnt malts. Medium-full bodied with a fine carbonation and a smooth velvety texture. Flavor of coffee, dark unsweetened bakers chocolate, and oats.Sweetness is restrained here. Mid palate has a moderate bitterness, along with some woody notes. Finish is semi dry and slightly astringent. A peppery bitterness lingers. Nicely done.
Pours out a deep black color with a nice brown head.  aroma was very malty with lots of coffee and sweetness to it.  flavor is very much the same.  damn fine porter!

Bottle. Very dark brown colour nearly black. First coffe notes in the aroma then more coffe, this time green coffe notes. Very great flavour of coffee, roastedness, sweetness and some maltness too. Very nice and tasty.

12 oz bottle. Poured a dark brown color. Nearly opaque with red highlights. Head was thick and tan with good retention. There was some tattered lace left on the glass at the end. Subdued aroma of roasty malt and coffee. Delicately sweet with minimal roastiness. There was no appreciable bitterness. Tasted of milk chocolate and light coffee. Medium bodied and fairly smooth. Decent, but a bit overrated I think (99th percentile the day I rated it).

This bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a head of fine to medium sized dark brown colored bubbles that were mostly lasting and left behind a opaque no visible carbonation black colored body. The nice aroma was malty brown malt and dark malt. The mouth feel was tingly at the start and at the finish. The flavor contained notes of malt mild hops dark malt brown malt and coffee. Delicious and one I would certainly buy again.

Poured an opaque black.  Minimal head, no retention.  Aroma of roasted espresso beans and chocolate.  Palate was of roasted coffee and a lot of good roasted malty character with not a whole lot of hop finish.  Aftertaste was left slightly bitter from the malts.  A pretty good porter.

12oz bottle from either Wife or Mother-in-law ended up with six of them. Oatmeal oats and coffee aroma. Body was black with dark tan head, spotty lacing. Milky body texture with coffee as the main flavor. Smooth on the palate yes whih I had more.
12oz Bottle Pours out almost black topped with a light tan head. Gtreat aroma of Coffee, roast, and chocolate. A lot of coffee on this one. very tasty thanks Jordan for sharing.

Black, with a touch of red around the edges. Nice, big dense brown head. Big coffee aroma, and huge coffee flavor, too. Smoooth and sweetish notes, too. Very easy to drink, as well. Thanks to Buckybeer for the trade!

Bottle from Pantanap; Nose of roastiness, coffee, and malt; Red- tinged brown with a rusty tan head; flavor of chocolate, coffee, oatmeal, (which shows up in a nice ly thick body), and a light hop presence.

Thanks to Ughsmash for the brew!  Very pleasant nose - my fav part of this beer - coffee (obviously), lots of milk chocolate, oak, roasty tones...what you might expect.  Flavor was quite similar - pleasant with the coffee, def not overpowering - finished with a mild bitter bite.  Only knock was the below average appearance - quite thin/minimal lacing.  Otherwise, definitely a nice beer - silky smooth.  However, if it was a little chewier - it would be epic.

Bottle:  Near black pour with a smaller tan head.  Nose is intense with coffee and heavy roast.  The coffee takes over the flavor, but is accented well with cocoa, bittersweet chocolate, and roastiness.  Wow, thats a helluva lotta coffee!  Thanks BuckDich for sharing.

Very good, Dereks fresh bottle. Bit of burnt coffee and molasses and chocolate malt aroma.  Soft creamy and full mouthfeel, silky smooth. black,with lots of head.  Well malted, milk chocolate,  and gets all the bitterness down.
Bottle. A black beer with a beige head. The aroma is of roasted malt, coffee and chocolate and spices, so is the taste. Medium to full body with a long smooth coffee finish.

12 oz. bottle courtesy of Bockyhorsey - Pours a thick dark brown color with a one finger thick tan head.  Light lacing.  Aroma is mostly coffee with a touch of more coffee.  Its quite nice.   Flavor again, is mostly coffee.  Has a pleasant bitterness.  No lingering aftertaste.  Medium body.  Nice, neutral palate.  This is probably the best coffee porter/beer Ive had.  Thanks Bill and Wendy.  Next time, Ill take a six pack!

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2007 acquired in trade from incutrav...arigato! nice black pour the devil would be proud of. aromas of coffee beans, sweet malts and anise. flavor is dominated by dark roasted espresso beans. as it warms the coffee steps aside to reveal vinous flavors, dark dried fruits and star anise. very creamy rich mouth feel  and a bitter after taste like ive got espresso beans tucked in my gums. i cried a little when i finished it knowing i cant get it here...4.7
rerated 9/17/07...second bottle with 2/2/07 label. clearly starting to lose the coffee bite in the aroma and flavor that was enjoyed the first time around. creaminess is amped but bitterness is more like stale cold coffee than fresh. 4
UPDATED: MAY 6, 2008 Huge aroma of fresh coffee.  Slightly intimidating.  Taste has strong coffee, but it doesnt dominate, there is still room for roasted notes and faint chocolate.  Solid porter.
A very nice porter.  Full bodied.  The oatmeal is there, and so is the coffee.  But even while coffee is the dominant character, it doesnt overwhelm the malt and chocolate flavors.

12 oz bottle shared with willblake and Dickinsonbeer. Poured a deep dark black with a light brown head that left an oily resin on my glass. Aroma (my first 10 ever) is ridiculous, it smells so much like coffee I would swear I was standing inside an air conditioned Dunkin Donuts. This one goes down smooth and creamy with a nice medium/full palate and some light carbonation. Flavor is coffee, espresso, roasted malt....excellent. This is one great beer.

Bottle.
Dark brown coloured with a beige head.
Roasted aroma of coffee and hops.
Roasted flavour of coffee, liquorice and hops.

Thick and black with thick brown creamy head.
Big aroma and flavor of rish roasty malt, coffee and thick creamy body.
Great beer! Wish it had a bit more alcohol.
Got more Bockyhorsey???

Bottled. Dark reddish brown. Light brown head. Unroasted coffee, light cocoa, brown sugar, spice and some roast in the aroma. Flavour is roasted, sweet, loads of coffee, sweet and sugary. Very smooth. Full bodied. Is roasted and sweet in the end. Fantastic brew. Thanks to Ugshmash for this brew.

Pours an almost black body like a stout with a thin lasting head.  Aroma is coffee and cream, mocha, dark chocolates, vanilla and oatmealy.  Intense coffee flavor but it isnt sharp or astringent it is smooth - kinda like a frappacino.  Moderate sweetness and a nice long lasting aftertaste.  Reminded me a lot of the Founders Breakfast stout which we had previous to this one.

(12oz bottle, thanks chris_o) Small creamy brown head atop cola/black body.  Aroma is meidum sweet, coffee, light sugar.  Taste is moderately sweet, coffee, some sugar, earthy.  Good bitterness in the finish.  Creamy medium body.
This should be a stout.  It pours dark black with notes of coffee and bitter chocolate.  Those flavors smoothly reflect the mouthfeel thanks to the oatmeal.  A Nice LONG finish.

Bottle. Pours dark rich oily brown... almost black. Minimal head and looks like minimal carbonation as well. Smells like breakfast (brewing coffee and oatmeal). Fairly rich on the palate with silky smooth carbonation. Roasted malt and coffee... lots and lots of coffee. Not a ton of hops. Fairly one-dimensional, as far as the coffee goes. I kinda like it, but Im not a coffee snob...

Bottle, with thanks to Pantanap, pours a dark brown with an off-white head that drifts to a thin whisp, minimal lacing.  Strong aroma of mostly fresh roast coffee, and subtle hints of chocolate and vanilla.  Taste is roasty oats and more coffee.  Palate is full, creamy and smooth.  Coffee fans rejoice, this is a good one!

12 oz bottle.  Ebony with a crema head.  Dark chocolate caramels with just enough musty molasses to soften the sweetness.  So inviting.  Coffee with cream, anise and licorice.  Light carb, almost medium, but still rich.  Mild drying and coffee beans.  Lingering oatmeal.

(Bottle 35,5 cl) Courtesy of madsberg. A black beer with a tint of red and a light brown head. Extremely burned, coffeeish and ashy nose. Medium body full of hard burned malts and ashy accents - about a ton of coffee in here. The finish is dry with a subdued bitterness. 270607
Bottled. Almost black coloured. Loads of coffee beans in the aroma. Very nice roasty coffee flavour. Smooth mouthfeel. Very pleasant.
Pours black with creamy tan head. Aroma of strong coffee and roasted malt. Flavor was mostly coffee with some chocolate and malt. Very smoothe.
Pours almost black with a thin creamy tan head.  Aroma of bitter coffee and bittersweet chocolate.  Taste much the same, almost like an unsweetened iced coffee.  Nice!
Aromas of coffee, chocolate, butterscotch, and some vanilla. I could have smelled this all night. My first sip was decadence, and then the flavors deminished. Still a great beer.

This comes out of the bottle as a dark brown beer but turns black in the glass.  The tan head is thin, but it does some nice lacing nonetheless.  The predominant aroma is coffee supported by roasted dark malts and oatmeal.  The flavor seems to intensify whats found in the nose, and to that mix a little chocolate, alcohol, and earthy bitterness is added.  Very smooth and quite tasty.<font size=-4><a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Liquor, Milwaukee, WI<font size=-1>
12 oz bottle shared with toncatcher.  Awesome black pour with decent head.  Aromas were super coffee.  Iced black coffee on the flavor with just enough sweetness to make it a very very tasty brew.

12oz bottle courtesy of Hopscotch-A dark black body with a small tan head and an aroma of coffee, roasted malt, and sweetness. Taste of coffee and chocolate with the body being a little thin. Good tasting brew.

Bottle from Woodmans East in Madison purchased 5/25. Enjoyed side by side with a 2005 Dark Lord. While very good, this proved to be inferior to the DL, although better in the quality-to-price ratio. Notes of dark roasted coffee and oatmeal on the nose lead into a decidedly (and deliciously) chewy chocolate and coffee beast. Well crafted, with a smooth and sweet finish.

Bottle (Thanks Ughsmash).  Pours a deep, dark brown with a tiny tan head.  This smelled more like coffee than what I drink in the morning!!  Unreal the amount of coffee in the aroma.  Also had some traces of oats and dark chocolate.  Flavor is VERY roasted coffee, bordering on it being burnt.  Very tasty if you like deep, rich, strong coffee.

Bottle thanks to Badbeer and Nolankowal poured a deep dark brownish black color with a tiny tan head. The aroma was fresh roasted coffee beans with some oats, hops, chocolate, toffee and burnt malts. Flavor was almost like eating coffee beans with some oatmeal. The body was a bit thin with not much in the way of carbonation.

Big thanks to Quake1028 for bringing this coffee gone wild beer.Pours deep brown in color with tan head. This beer has simply a huge coffee aroma. I can sense a light sweetness behind the coffee but that was about it. The flavor starts with big and bold black cup of coffee as well as some burnt malts. Just like the aroma the coffee is simply huge in the taste too. Reminds me a lot of Dunedins Coffee Brown Ale. This will go well along side of bacon, eggs and hash browns in the morning. I got no sense of the ABV.

Bottle. Unbelievable Porter. Poured a dark brown with a dark tan head. Aroma of coffee. Taste was complex, deep coffee flavor, subdued sweetness, and a nice malt flavor with a bit of tartness. Great mouthfeel!
Excellent beer! I would buy this one again!

Courtesy of Quake1028. Thanks, John. Folgers, Walking into a Starbucks, Juan Valdezs bag, the smell of Seattle if the entire city caught fire...these thinsg are what this beer smells like. COFFEE!!!! Intense, unrelenting, massive coffe int he aroma. Maybe some chocolate....who knows? My olfactory senses were body slammed by all the coffe. Good thing I love that aroma. The body is dark brown to black and holds a creamy and lasting mocha head.  Has a great round mouthfeel that is fairly thick for a porter, but also pretty oily. The fore is coffee and chocolate followed by some very faint dark fruit notes and a steady blast of roasted malt. Its actually kind of brutish, but as I love coffee so damn much I dont at all mind being brutalized in this way.

Thanks to Stine for providing this one through a trade. Who is brewing a pot of coffee? Oh wait, thats just this beer being opened. Body is dark brown, with a creamy brown head. Nose is all coffee, with maybe some chocolate seeping through, but its tough to pull it out. Flavors of coffee, chocolate, malt. Medium to light bodied. Creamy mouthfeel. Smooth finish, sweet with some roasted cocoa notes coming through. If you like coffee, this is your beer. Very well done.

Thanks to Ughsmash and pantanap who each sent me a bottle. Pours deep brown with a small head. Fair lacing. Huge coffee aroma with some sweet caramel malt. Nicely bitter coffee taste. Medium to full body. Somewhat creamy texture. Nicely done.

Courtesy moejuck.  Pours pitch black with a light brown head.  The aroma is monster coffee and chocolate.  Cant say much else about it because thats what it is.  The taste is smoother than I thought, obviously big coffee and some chocolate and malts.  Nice full body, with a slick, oily mouthfeel.  Very nice chocolate, especially in the finish.  I think there is more coffee in the nose than in the taste, which was a bit of a surprise and Im glad it had more chocolate in the taste.  Good brew.

12oz. Bottle
$8.99 4-Pack
Steves Liquor Madison

The Devil Made Me Do It poured a black hole into my snifter. This beer does not let one bit of light shine through. I think its actually making the room darker. A 1 finger tan head formed and quickly fell to a thick ring of head with a floating island of chunk. Leaves chunky lacing after each sip. This is one of those beers that looks like itll be packed with flavor. 

This beer smells great. Mounds of the finest freshly ground coffee beans greet the nose. Roasted malts are there along with a shot of cream and 2 cubes of sugar. Smells like a quality freshly brewed cup of coffee.

Again, a freshly brewed cup of coffee as soon as this beer hits the tongue. Mild vanilla and cream add a nice sweetness that accompanies the coffee perfectly. Moderate coffee bitterness on the swallow thats always welcome.

Creamy mouthfeel from the addition of oatmeal. Actually has a little prickliness in there that awakens the tongue and really lets the flavors take hold.

This is a highly drinkable beer. I can see myself drinking this anytime of the day whether its with breakfast or after dinner.

Tyranena makes some great beers and this is no exception. A porter thats missing the porter aspect and filled with roasty delicious coffee.

5/12/07

Bottle courtesy of Moejuck: Poured a deep black color porter with a small foamy head with average retention and some lacing. Aroma of dry coffee is dominating but not in an exceeding way which sometime render coffee flavoured beer a bit gross. Taste of medium roasted malt with subtle bitter notes with some coffee which brings dry notes. I would have preferred a bit more chocolate notes and maybe a touch of sweetness to balance the dryness of the coffee but this beer is still very enjoyable. Full body with some light carbonation which fits the style.

Nice aromas.  The oatmeal smoothness comes through.  The taste is grainy with some oatmeal and coffee of course.  Some bittersweet chocolate as well.  Sweetness on the backside.  I really enjoyed this one.  Has the subtlety, flavors, and textures I love in a dark beer.

Bottle shared with HogTownHarry & biegaman -- courtesy of HogTownHarry. Pours a very dark brown, almost black, with a small diminishing light-brown head. Nice aroma of roasted malt, roasted coffee, chocolate and oats. Flavours like coffee on ice, I love it! Goes down smooth. Creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied. An excellent Porter.

Dense black with a smallish capping of sandy browned foam on top. Lace fills in the glass surface nicely with big gobby strings and things.

Morning nose of sweet roasted espresso-like coffee and oatmeal waffles; some black malt, burnt chocolate cookies, and a tiny bit of peppery spice. Very attractive nose to this one.

Taste is refined within a terrific draw of pale black malt sweetness, whole grain cereal, and a lot of chocolate enduced coffee roastedness right upfront; then spent milk rounds off with a creamy center, and a lovely little hop note spicing up the back end with leftover returns of coffee and chocolate. The bitterness is perfectly fitting within the roasted character all the way through, which makes this one heavenly yummy treat and a great drinker. Nice mix of chocolate and coffee parts.

Body is mediumish to full with an extended creamyness that plays well with what roasted and bitter notes tend to keep on sticking on the palate. Chocolate milk spikes with a nice rounded coffee really takes the whole thing and puts it together once its sat a while. Which isnt long, cuz this stuff is a real treat to behold and drink down. Solid stuff by Tyranena. Nice to see they do something other then the yummy IPAs they do.

Bottle from Ryan, thanks!  Pours out a dark black color without much of a head at all.  Smell is huge overwhelming coffee and chocolate.  Some sweetness and oats as well.  Taste is thick like an imperial stout and full of coffee and chocolate.  A seriously good beer, very thick for a porter.  Reminds me of a more coffee flavored oflabrikken.  Awesome stuff here, thanks Ryan!

Bottle (12oz).  Shared with blankboy and biegaman, my bottle via trade with oakbluff.  Pours deep red-brown, with a speckled brown head.  Roast coffee, dark malt, minty hops, mild lactose - smoooooth.  Taste is smooth, rich, nutty chocolate and coffee, milky, mild grainy hops - did I say smooth?  Rich, thick, creamy, mildly astringent - great coffee liqueur taste.  Yumm.

From a 12oz Bottle.  Purchased at Rileys Wines of the World in Madison, WI.  Pours a dark black, completely opaque color with a thin layer of creamy beige head.  Some gentle swirling rejuvenates the creamy topping, but it dissipates more quickly than desired.  Tons of coffee in the aroma, which imparts a borderline smoky, ashy character.  A little bit of toasted oats and dark chocolate malt add a bit of enjoyable complexity, but the coffee mostly dominates.  Medium bodied, creamy carbonated mouthfeel.  Tons of coffee greets the palate, but it has a smooth flavor that doesnt present any harsh, bitter, tannic, or burned flavors that often accompany coffee additions.  Great silky texture.  The coffee flavors give way to some creamy dark chocolates and an almost milky flavor.  Long lasting finish of subtly smooth chocolate flavors.  Tons of deep dark malts without any roasted or burned flavors; impressive.  Not an overly complex porter, but very solid, well-constructed, and enjoyable overall.
Bottle drunk 4/24. Beautiful dark brown color. No head at all. Nice  fresh roasted coffee aroma. The taste was of strong coffee. Smoooth with oily/creamy mouthful. Medium bodied. Very good brew.

Bottle courtesy of Ughsmash.  Pours brown with a tan head.  Smells strongly of coffee beans and chocolate.  Tastes like coffee with some sweet malt.  Some peppery splashes are present on the finish.  Decent for what it is.

Picked up a single 12-oz bottle from The Coffee Grounds in Eau Claire, WI. Pours an opaque dark brown brew with a thick tan head. Aroma has a lot of coffee, some vanilla, dark chocolate, and a touch of oatmeal. Taste is chocolate/barley malt with a strong espresso feel. Palate is slightly carbonated and a little metalic. Finish leaves a coffee aftertaste and then fades to vanilla. Those who like coffee in their beer will not be disappointed.

12oz bottle from Crosling. Rich murky black pour eschews a large fresh ground coffee bean aroma, sitting on a bed of vanilla and lavender incense. Silky and luxurious in the mouth, only as bitter as the best black coffees and similarly rewarding.

Bottle. Thanks to Stine for sending me this one. Poured a thick black body with a huge head, debated giving this a 5. Heavy coffee aroma with some chocolate, malt. Creamy mouthfeel. Big chocolate taste, noticable coffee feel. Thick mouthfeel that was very smooth, very easy to drink. Good Porter.

Very dark pour- some hints of garnite when put to light. Chocolate milk head with good retention.
Smell- espresso and chocolate. Yum!
Taste- very coffee forward with dark chocolate riding shotgun. Roast is smoootthh. Gotta be the oatmeal! No cloying or sweetness which is much appreciated. Hops are present but more in the background. The porter is style works well with the coffee - nice change over a big stout. A beer with such strong coffee needs a solid malt base, and this has it. Great drinkability and tasty as all hell. Fastastic brew!

Bottle from my many friends, I got three over DLD weekend: Pours nearly opaque with a small but lasting frothy ring and some lace.  The aroma has notes of coffee, burnt malts, some toasted bread, chocolate, oatmeal, and grassy hops. The taste pretty much follows suit with rich sweet flavors of pumpernickel bread and bittersweet mocha over an espresso and smoked ham. The finish is more smoke and coffee...on and on...leads to a mouth feel that is more akin to porter, thin and watery, not a noticeable amount of oats IMO. Still despite the underwhelming feel this is a great brew where the coffee is in the forefront but allows other flavors and aromas to shine as well.

dark brown body with small beige head..aroma is huge in roasted malts, namely dark chocolate and bitter coffee...flavor is almost as strong with it massive coffee backbone (dry roasted creamed coffee with touches of toffee and burnt toast)...finishes slightly bitter and dry...very nice..it is very similar to Founders Breakfast Stout, and deserves to be talked about up there with the better coffee brews..

Bottle. Deep brown body with slight light penetration, medium dark tan head. Rich aroma of potent coffee beans, roasted malt, and chocolate. Reminds me of Founders Breakfast Stout. The body isnt quite as rich as that beer, but still offers a surprisingly smooth, coffee-dominated palate replete with roasted malt and a chocolate backbone. Offers some sweetness but on the dry side overall. This beer deserves its high marks.
Another i got to try this weekend.  Aroma is smooth coffee with some sweet toffee backing it up.  taste is very coffee with choco and toffee.  Very much a coffee beer but still very good.

Bottle courtesy of Juelze, thanks again! Dark brown pour with a short tan head. Aroma of pungent coffee, a bit of booze, some dark fruits, dark chocolate and a tinge of raspberry. Strong bitter coffee, roasted malts, a bit of raspberry and dark chocolate as well. Medium bodied...the carbonation is a bit much...bittersweet and roasty throughout with a roasty/dry finish. Pretty good.

Bottle shared by nolankowal: Pours black with virtually no head. Aroma, big coffee, and roasted malt notes, some chocolate, and a hint of oats. Flavor, coffee, chocolate, more coffee, some roasted malts, a bit of oats again. medium to thin body. Pretty damn tasty.

12oz bottle, courtesy of Monger.  Thanks, James!  Pours a dark black center; medium tan head with fine-bubbled lacing.  Lots of coffee in the aroma (slightly green); dark chocolate and some bitterness.  Medium-to-full mouthfeel: loads of slightly-green coffee upfront (as opposed to fully roasted), surrounded by bitter chocolate and some charred / burnt malts; slightly acidic and hints of citrus bitterness.  Decent stuff, but Im not a fan of how the coffee character plays out here.  Medium, dark chocolate and coffee finish; ends quite nicely.
Pours a deep dark brown with a brown head.  Aroma is of dark malts but is dominated by roasted coffee.  Flavor is roasted malts,and coffee.  The finish is a little to bitter and ashy though.

12 oz bottle via trade with Jason.  Pours a cola black color with a small brownish beige head.  Aroma of sweet roasted coffee malts and a bit of baking chocolate.  Taste is smooth and creamy rich coffee flavor with small hints of oats and chocolaty malts.  Like a lighter version of Breakfast Stout or Jah-va Stout as far as the taste goes.  Very nice.

Bottle from trade with JCaprioti. Great aroma, Sweet. Coffee, more like coffe grounds, Oat is obvious, and together I get a chocolate malt ball type scent. Clean orangy dark brown color, little to no head, just a small ring. Minor lace. Bitter coffee flavor, hints of grape and vine. Little soapiness. Get a little heat. Thick body, creamy oily smooth mouthfeel, bitterdry finish, Tasty brew. Great one to sniff and I never got tired of doing so. Well done and worth seeking out.
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: bottle....aroma: lots of roasted coffee and a bit of chocolate malt but the strong roast sensation is def. nice.....appearance: black liquidity, lighter body, with small light brown head....taste: not very heavy, a little bit creamy with medium level of carbonation.  im getting more of a bitter roasted coffe taste than anything else.  the finsh is slightly bitter.  not too much sweetness to this one....this is a pretty decent porter.
Poured an almost opaque black with ruby highlights and a small tan head.  Big coffee aroma with some ashey notes.  Roasty malt flavor with a medium body.

Damn near black pour, very thick, with a slight tan head.  Lots of toffee and coffee beans in the aromammm.  Rich, full bodied and creamy, velvety on the tongue.  Lots of coffee flavor balances with burnt malts, chocolate and toffee.  Some sweetness, but well balanced.  This beer is damn near perfect.  Thanks Jeff!

12 oz bottle, via Monger.  Pours a very dark brown colored body with minimal light passing through the edges.  Small brown foamy head ran to a thin ring.  The aroma is of heavily roasted coffee, bitter chocolate, burnt malt, oats, chalk, and a hint of alcohol.  Kinda like fresh espresso grounds.  The coffee, roast, and oatmeal really work well together.  Aggressive moderately bitter espresso smoothed out with the oats finishing with a slight burnt ashiness and a touch of sweetness.  Mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with a smooth velvety texture and light fine carbonation.  This was very nice.  Similar in alot of ways to Meantime Coffee.  Coffee first, then beer second.

(Bottle thanks Ughsmash) Pours devilish black Full coffee bean aroma with some smaller notes of parsley and dry roasted malt. Coffee flavour with parsley and some sweeter notes. Soft and smooth and clean mouthfeel with medium, near full body. The lingering aftertaste consist of dark malt and burned coffee. This is a very nice beer, but mostly a mind blowing coffee bomb.

12oz bottle acquired in trade with ughsmash (thanks!). Poured a dark black (with brown edges) and an averaged sized brown head. I could smell the coffee as I started pouring this one! I love coffee beers and this was a great start. Aromas of coffee grounds, espresso, chocolate, light vanilla, roast, and some oats. Tastes of vanilla, coffee (although not as strong as the aromas but definitely there), roast, burnt malts, oats, and chocolate. I love coffee in my beer and this one was a great example of what I expect when I read Imperial Coffee on the label!

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2013 4/05/2007:  "The Devil Made Me Do It" is an "Imperial Oatmeal Porter with Coffee Beans" that is near glack in color, opaque, and has a brown crown.  It looks thick from based on the pour.  The aroma is expensive coffee with some rich chocolate around the edges.  Dark chocolate, coffee, mocha, and cream round out the rich and robust flavor.  The alcohol is well integrated into the overall flavor.  My wife really seemed to enjoy this beer as well.  She took three drinks one right after another (which is unheard of) and proclaimed "This is really good!"  I had to take it away from her before she drank it all!  The body is full and quite thick.  It feels smooth and creamy in the mouth.  Overall, this is an excellent beer.  It can easily hold its own against the other great coffee and breakfast stouts out there.  Tyranena definitely knows how to make excellent, unique, and memorable brews.
12 oz bottle from buckybeer.  Thanks Mark!  This was a fantastic beer.  AllAboutStout also shared a bottle of this with me on 3/09/2007.  Thanks Steve!  I appreciate it.  Score:  8/3/8/4/17=4.0
. . . . . . . . . .
2007 Vintage
12/07/2010:  Tyranena The Devil Made Me Do It! Coffee Imperial Oatmeal Porter...  Aroma:  Intense darkly roasted espresso with a smooth chocolate-y sweetness that takes off the coffee edge.  Appearance:  Murky, ultra-dark cola brown color; pours silky smooth without much carbonation; thin, but dense tan-colored crown.  Flavor:  Semi-sweet and dark chocolate with a slash of high-text espresso; nice roasty coffee bean and accompanying bitterness in the middle (similar to the experience of sucking on a dark-roasted coffee bean) that is tempered quite a bit by oatmeal; short, but bold finish with a nice lingering sweet coffee aftertaste; quite a bit of dark chocolate comes out as the beer warms.  Palate:  Full-bodied; oily and ultra smooth; milky texture, but doesnt feel heavy.  Overall:  DAMN GOOD and still holding well despite the age; an excellent example of how both a coffee beer and an oatmeal beer should be!
12 fluid ounce bottle.  Score:  Score:  8/4/8/4/17=4.1

Bottle from Styles. Black body with small tan head. The aroma is heavy with espresso, chocolate, molases and lots of roasted burnt malt. Flavor is burnt marshmallow, roast, espresso and dark chocolate. Full body with soft carbonation and a silky, oatmeal texture. Nice, but a touch too sweet.

(bottle from ughsmash)black body with a brown head.aroma is of coffee,roasted malts,chocolate,and oatmeal.flavor does much of the same with some milk and alcohol thrown in.mouth feel is creamy,rich,and smooth.reminds me of breakfast stouts little brother.

Aroma is great. Subtle coffee and oat characteristics that arent overbearing. Looks great with a slight tan head. Lacing all the way down, for what its worth. Flavor was good, and alcohol well-hidden, but was quite thin. Tasted like oatmeal and coffee soda. Hints of oaky vanilla and mild nuttiness are there, but are overshadowed by the coffee. Not a complaint, seeing as how I CRAVE coffee and the bottle describes this beer as such. Just a tad simplistic. Medium carbonation and silky smooth going down. Well-balanced, but a little weak for a beer rated so high, IMO. Very drinkable and enjoyable but not terribly complex. Would definitely drink this quite often if given the opportunity, but Ill settle for trading for it every now and again.

12 oz. bottle from Styles, thanks Chris.  big nose of strong coffee.  pours almost black with a ruby edge and with a short tan head and spotty lace every time I tip my snifter.  flavor has hints of chocolate and roasted malts, but dominating everything is the strong coffee.  nice creamy mouth-feel from the oats.  enjoyable, but I would have liked it better with less coffee.

Big black pour w/ a huge thick creamy brown head w/ some great lacing.  Lots of coffe in the aroma, nice rich roasty malts hints of chocolate a touch of oat like grain and even a hint of some dark fruit.  Palate is full and well coated very lightly creamy.  Flavor has lots of dark chocolates lots of them then some great mocha coffees like a great espresso. some roast malts an oat grain touch and numm.  Good stufff.
This is another winner in the Brewers gone wild series.

Dense and black.  The aroma of the espresso machines as theyre being cleaned and refilled.  Good espresso, though.  Also some urinal cake smell.  First taste is of mayan chocolate.  The oatmeal comes very close to counteracting the astringency of the old coffee taste but fails at this.  Palate is like silk draped over a bed of nails.  Promising, but a bit unpleasant to my taste.

12 oz bottle
I wish this was more than a special release.  This was probably the best BGW release to date; if I had the cellar room I would go buy another four pack to have some for the future.  Still, if they can make something this then I am pretty sure they can do it again.  If you happen to come across this be sure to snap it up.  This is one of those beers that will grab your attention and not let go until the bottle has been empty for fifteen minutes.
Aroma / Appearance - The black body was smothered by a one finger head the color of cardboard.  Thick sheets of lacing clung to the sides of my snifter as I took sips leaving behind a history of the levels.  The nose was very rich with a first impression of raisins and oatmeal.  Further reflection revealed straight black coffee, smoky bacon and dark rich chocolate.  A milky backbone holds it all together.
Flavor / Palate - The taste of fluid oatmeal coated my throat on the first sip along with straight black coffee.  Raisins, rich chocolate and oreos dipped in low fat milk form the second wave of flavors.  Leathery wood tastes come towards the middle with oats very strong throughout.  The finish of smoked bacon and malty coffee completes an excellent experience overall.  This reminds me of a hybrid baltic porter moreso than a straight porter.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2007 thick black pour. thick reddish tan head. The aroma is absolutely amazing. drink very smooth. superb on the ol palate, and balanced very nicely. Im a porter fan and this one is likely the best yet.! GRAB one if you can LIMITED RELEASE, probably all GONE:(

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2007 ***This is the BOMB!***Pours black w/ a brown maple robe. Froth is shallow and residual lacing is minimal. Aroma is heavily roasted w/ coffee beans. Full nectar w/ soft and creamy residual effers. Huge roasted malts packing a ton of blackened coffee beans. A mild sweetness is upfront . It keeps the roast component interesting, almost turning mexican chili pepper. Its not complex but sure is tastey. I could drink a few of these in a sitting. The finish is long on flavor w/ a mild, velvet bittering. I savor every sip. Overall: smooth, rich, and heavily roasted. Highly recommended. p/s Ill be headed to the Betty Ford clinic before long. This stuff is addictive and Im jonesin for another bottle.

THANX TO BUCKYBEER! Pour was a dark brown with a huge foamy tan head. Make that a brown head. Nose is cold coffee even before I sniff. As the creamy head settles, the nose is still all coffee. Almost like walking into a starbucks. Loved the flavor. This is a coffee drink, trace of creamy, chocolate, and dark brew. I am loving this. Wish I could have a case of this. Mouth feel was full, satisfying. Great brew. No big negative , almost a perfect brew. I MUST agree with roberts reality, there is a ash, burnt after taste, but not a negative.

Nice dark brown to black color,small tan head that had a decent hang time and managed to leave a bit of a lace behind.The aroma was roasty and malty with a decent chocolate and almost sweet milk chocolate thing going on.The flavor was quite pleasant.malty and chocolatey with a decent semi sweet chocolate taste,some hints of hops in the middle and end with a nice roasty side.Theres a slight wine like thing going on as well a bit oily in the middle but over all very nice brew and well worth having again.

Somewhat opaque dark brown pour, ruby highlights. Fully and quickly diminishing dark tan head. Leaves a beige ring at the edge of the glass. Minor lacing. Aroma is mostly coffee. I wouldnt go so far as to say this immediately feels one dimensional, but near overwhelming coffee certainly inhibits easy clarification and identification of subtle malt nuances. Some chocolate and moderate roastiness are noticeable, hazelnuts and a sour milk note on the back end as well. The coffee in the aroma does smell good. Quite a bit more balance comes in the flavor. Still very heavy coffee. The combination of that with big roasty chocolate tastes simulates an interesting peanut butter note. I feel like every sip taken brings me closer to being so awake my eyeballs dry out because Im too alert to blink. This would be fantastic at 9 a.m. in the board room. Finishes roasty and very dry with slight sugariness. Palate is bubbly, sticky, medium to full bodied, with a sweet/dry balance until a very dry climax at the bitter end.

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2007 Pours a black color with brown head that fades quickly.  Aroma is intensely coffee, verging on an expresso aroma or like opening up a a vacuumed sealed bag of your favorite French roast coffee.  Tyranena seems to have the most memorable and savory aromas that my nose has had the pleasure of inhaling.  If I keep sniffing this beer Im going to turn in the Afrin Man.   Taste does not disappoint with the coffee flavors forging ahead amongst all the flavors.  Im picking up some chocolate, milk sugars, roasted malt and a nice fruity, almost cherry like taste thats very subtle but shows up in the finish.  This beer is nicely carbonated and finishes pretty smooth with a bit of dryness.  Damn grocery store only had a 4pk of this but if they have more I will be stocking up.  Excellent job Tyranena, keep up the good work!

Biiiiig beer! Interessting interplay between the dark fruit, molasses, malt, coffee, and hops. Sometime hard to differentiate which is what. Great body. Nice tan head with lace. Good carbonation. Full flavor, clean, nicely balanced, and good finish. Not a session beer. Had a bottle at Bodega Brew Pub, downtown La Crosse, Wisconsin USA

Black Color with Espresso Ring. Strong Burnt Roast Coffee Bean Aroma. Medium Body...Malty Oat Foundation...Some Sweet Chocolate Mixing With Continued Coffee Roasts...Wonderful Burnt Roast Overtones Throughout..Light Milky Taste, Sweet Malt Balancing the Bitterness of the Coffee....Dry and Bitter Cooked Finish.  Solidly Delicious Beer....Although the Coffee Roasts, Wonderful as they Are, Create and Ashen Taste in the Aftertaste.
