Bottle: Black coffee in color, minor light brown foamy head, dwindles quickly, sparce lacing, a ring of bubbles remains. &nbsp Very strong coffee nose. &nbsp Smells like freshly roasted beans! &nbsp Minor aspects of cocoa and thats about it. &nbsp The coffee really dominates. &nbsp Coffee, cocoa, roasted malts, milk sugar, slight ash and charred wood on the tongue. &nbsp A bit more diverse on the tongue than in the nose. &nbsp Backside has a soft hop bitterness. &nbsp Cant get over how coffee oriented the nose is. &nbsp I am not much of a coffee fan, but this one is well built. &nbsp Full bodied, moderate mouthfeel. &nbsp Milk and sugar coffee finish. &nbsp If I have coffee, maybe once or twice a year, this is how I have it... plenty of milk and sugar in it. &nbsp A very unique and enjoyable brew. &nbsp Thanks John for this one!

12oz bottle via trade with brigadier - Thanks Nathan!! - Pours very balck witha  big tan head.  Great big coffee aroma but underneath some roasted malts and even a bit of bakers chocolate.  Flavor is mainly dominated by coffee as well but a good balance of bakers chocolate, and some good roasted malts and a little of that oatmeal sweetness..  The oatmeal adds wonderful texture to this full bodied malty wonder.   Alcohol cannot be found.. Very good brew.. I really did enjoy this one.. Might have even been better than i anticipated it to be..

Pours a dark black with a tan head.HUGE coffee and malt aroma to it.SIlky smooth texture with a big bitter coffee flavor to it.Hits of vanilla and chocolate tease you in the background.Wonderful balance to it!Another Winner!

For the style, i dont think it gets any better then this. Awesome coffee taste, but not to overpowering, really thick, rich with a ton of flavors going on. smells awesome. I really have become a fan of porters and havent found any that i didnt like, but this one really blew me away, one of my top 5 beers ever. you dont have to like coffee to like this beer, as i HATE coffee.

Black color with a thin head.  Very powerful coffee aroma.  Wow... Okay, i can tell there is a nice oatmeal porter under this (strong malt, sweet oatmeal), but this tastes like a pot of cold coffee.  I happen to like that.

Smooth coffe scent which joebrew (who provided this pour) said smells like a strong espresso but to an uninitiated heathen like me smells like plain ol coffee.  Smooth oatmeal stout base with coffe on top.  Id love this one if it werent for the coffee.

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2007 Pours nice dark reddish black with a huge medium tan head.  Holy coffee on the nose.  It smells like a very strong espresso with hints of chocolate.  The flavor is very thin like that of coffee, not stout.  It actually tastes like a spiked espresso with nice milk chocolate and whipped cream.  This is an awesome coffee beer, you bettter like a nice espresso to drink it though.
user_location: Farewell Minny; Hello Puyallup, Washington, USA

text:
Served in my Delirium tulip glass.
Pours a dark very dark brown color with only the slightest head that quickly recedes to nothing.
Smell is coffee. Predominantly nothing but coffee. But its good and no problem at all.
Taste is again very good coffee. There are some roasted flavors coming through. The mouthfeel is full, robust and pretty tasty for the amount of coffee that comes through. Has a very good taste, mouthfeel for being a porter. This could hang with most of the coffee stouts that are out there right now. Another very good, solid porter from Tyranena. Its safe to say they understand their porters!

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2007 Bottle from trade with ughsmash (great extra!). I knew this beer would be special from the moment that cap flew off and I got a hit of the amazing coffee aromas. Coffee dominates this beer, but in an amazingly balanced and satisfying way. Beautiful jet black body and dark chocolate mouse tan head. Imagine smelling a cold coffee filter paper and youve got the measure of this beer. The coffee is mixed with powered milk chocolate and the oatmeal lends a satisfying and nourishing element to this wacky porter. Soft, thick and rich mouthfeel. If youre into coffee you simply must try this beer!

Bottle from trade with drewbeerme. Daark brown with tan head. Aroma is strong coffee. Flavor is roasted malts, a lotta coffee, and a lil bits of oat and hop notes. Well balanced but just not that much going on. Alcohol well hidden. Nice, easy drinking but I guess I was expecting a little more pow.

12 ounce bottle from Ughsmash.  Opaque, very dark fudgy brown with a dark brown mostly fading head.  Aroma is mostly coffee.  Actually, it smells just like those bulk coffee bins in the supermarket.  Theres some background chocolate character.  The flavor is double shot mochaccino with a chocolate donut.  Really robust coffee flavor.  Rich silky mouth feel.  Bitter finish.  Pretty pleasant.

Bottle via trade with Ughsmash.  Pours pitch black and thick with a tan head.   Chocolate malt aroma with big coffee grounds notes.  More chocolate malt in the flavor a very rich coffee note.  Somewhat astringent and fruity.  Clean, dry finish.

12 ounce bottle.  Pours brown out of the bottle, but appears black in the glass.  Powerful nose, dominated by coffee.  Fairly nice flavor, also dominated by coffee.  Mild hints of fruits after the mid-palate.  Would love to taste more decadent malt (chocolate or caramel, etc.)  None of the Brewers Gone Wild beers have been super impressive.  Theyre good brews, just not great.

Im not the biggest fan of Tyranenas regular offerings, but this is the second of their "Brewers Gone Wild" series Ive tried, and thought both very good.  This is a sweet but intensely roasty porter. 

This beer poured an inky black and had very little head which stuck to the side of my glass.  Aroma was very resiny...smelled like singed tree sap.  The smell was almost like tar, which wasnt a bad thing.  Taste was a sweet coffee taste up front (think coffee ice cream) with a lot of roastiness ("burned pizza crust") following at the finish.  Delicious.  Mouthfeel is a bit rough, but still drinkable.

The pour is a very dark brown with a two finger dirty white head. It looked picture perfect. The aroma is very much of coffee grounds, used ones. The flavor starts out coffee with a creamy feel and finishes nicely dry. This is a very good proter.

Courtesy of Styles
Bottle:  Aroma is loaded with roasted cofee with moderate dark chocolate and a hint of vanilla.  It pours a dark brown with no transparency and a small beige head.  The flavor starts with moderate chocolate that is quickly overtaken with lots of roasted coffee.  There are some hints of caramel in the background.  Its very cafe mocha-ish.

Black in color, thin layer of whitish head.  Nice strong espresso/coffee aroma without the stale coffee smell that some coffee porters/stouts have.  Also some nutty oatmeal aromas.  Medium-light in body.  Nice to drink a beer that features coffee, but doesnt feel heavy.  Roasted chocolate malt flavors with a slightly bitter but not caustic finish.  A good balance of coffee flavors and porter characteristics.

Bottle... Pitch black ale has a small, creamy, dark beige head with an orange tint. Lots of freshly ground coffee in both the aroma and flavor. Maybe some cocoa, maybe not... mostly coffee. Tangy flavor; mildly acidic with medium, singed bitterness. Full-bodied with a creamy mouthfeel and fizzy carbonation. Very lightly sour, bitter finish. Kudos to ughsmash for shipping the bottle to me!
Lots of very strong coffee in the aroma.Pours black with a medium tan head.Flavor is a lot like the aroma,very strong coffee definatly dominates.Medium to full mouthfeel with a huge coffee finish.

Bottle.  So, Ive consumed about 4 of these now.  So, it pours to a black body with a really dense and largely bubbled creamy mocha brown head.  Nice lacing.  The aroma is rich, sweet milk chocolate, espresso, and oatmeal brownies.  The flavor is rich.  Coffee brownies, oatmeal, milk chocolate molten sugar, and vanilla.  The palate is rich, creamy, and has that nice oatmeal feel.  I like it.  The flavor is good and the beer is balanced.

Pours an opaque oily black with a large frothy dark tan head that leaves a spider web of thin lace behind as it subsides.  Huge coffee aroma has some mild earthy caramel and dark chocolate undertones.  Body starts with some sticky caramel malty sweetness and a finely dissolved carbonation that eventually dries out into a more bittersweet roasty mocha finish.  Fairly smooth mouthfeel and big coffee presence make for an interesting and enjoyable brew.

Beer pours pitch-black with dark tan/brown head. Head quickly fades, leaving brown ring around pint glass. Nose is sweet coffee, very appealing. Smooth mouthfeel, little carbonation. Medium bitterness, more coffee flavor. Really very impressive overall. Like drinking an iced coffee made the right way. Top notch offering in Tyranenas "Brewers Gone Wild" series.

Bottle courtesy of brewblackhole...Really nice coffee aroma with hints of almonds.  Black with a thick brown head.  Full and smooth palate supports slightly roasted coffee tastes.  This is very east to drink and tasty.  Im not the biggest fan of coffee brews--but this is one is done nicely.

Dark brown/black. Nice frothy tan head leaving a creamy ring. Rich cold coffee aroma. 
Flavor is the best part. Full of rich, good, coffee, thick with oatmeal creaminess, sweet with dark sugary vanilla. Good stuff all around in here.

A very black porter - looks much like an Imperial Stout, though not quite as thick.  Im really impressed with the delicious, strong, natural creamy coffee flavor!  Very roasty and full-bodied - crisp, coffee bean and vanilla aroma.  It is very earthy and nutty.  Smooth, creamy finish,  slightly sweet, with only a hint of bitter astringency.  Good indeed.

Bottle from Ughsmash (thanks, Jason!) - nearly black pour (just a little light coming in around the edges), with a small ring of off-white foam - dark roast coffee beans hit you in the aroma at first, followed by sweet cream, chocolate, a hint of caramel - moderately sweet up front, with some sweet vanilla creaminess throughout - strong coffee bitterness balances out the sweetness a bit - some blueberry and cherry come through in the midst of it all - a strange floral quality crops up near the finish, but it works suprisingly well - silky mouthfeel - ends with roastiness and a lingering coffee presence - just different enough to be wonderful.

12oz from JCapriotti, big thanks for this one.  Black with a short lived one finger tan head.  Aroma of freshly ground coffee beans, some roasted malts, sweet dark chocolate, a bit of oatmeal, and maybe some lactose or something else thats fairly sweet.  Flavor is fairly sweet up front with a good amount of coffee present throughout  There is enough roasty bitterness to keep the sweetness from getting cloying.  The bitterness peaks at a 3 out of 10.  Medium bodied with soft smooth light carbonation.  Awesome beer.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: Pours dark brown, with a light brown head. Aroma is coffee, with much smaller amounts of chocolate and roasted malt. Flavors is coffee, chocolate, roasted malt, and oatmeal. Medium body. Really nice, but a little more sweetness would have made this fantastic. Thanks to brewblackhole for this bottle.

Bottle. Pours a dark rich brown color with a medium tan head. Aroma of roasted malt and coffee. Taste of coffee and roasted malt. Has the sweet oatmeal flavor similar to an oatmeal stout. A well balanced creamy finish.

A black pour with a small tan head and light lacing.  The aroma is of day old raw coffee grounds. Which for some reason I do like. Flavor is also a raw coffee flavor with a touch of cocoa and maybe a little molasses. I just wish it was a little sweeter and not so raw. It will be interesting what some aging will do to it.

Low hiss as the cap comes off, pouring as translucent and mahogany, yet mostly opaque and chestnut black in the glass. A sparse tan moss head transforms into mocha edges and tan sawdust on top. Depth defying nose drums with espresso beans dipped in blackened, lactic dark chocolate. Campfires catch smores off guard and emanate an admirable sweet and burnt aromatic fulfillment. Unrefined bakers bricks and caramel scorched in the kettle pull up the rear. Heavy smashed mocha beans slow down in the mouth to a chewy, dark chocolate tune. Broiled fudge bake gets cemented with an espresso bottom. Charred oats meet singed smore sticks several moments after the marshmallow is lost, but the sweetness still retains a glimpse of the dark, Swiss chocolate filler. Balance favors the bean, but the burnt turtle fudge surrounding it gives enough caramel sweetness to keep it on kilter. Lactic, burnt café de cacao and dense chocolate mouse cling to classic coffee characteristics in the end.
The coffee is rough, raw, and uneven yet well mashed oatmeal adds silky smoothness. Hint of liccorice. More carbonation would help.

Deep black with a thin tan film of a head.  Aroma is loaded with coffee and dark chocolate.  Flavor is lots more coffee with a bit of cereal sweetness, semi-sweet chocolate and a nice bitter hops bite.  The finish is long and roasty and stays with you for a while.  Heavy on the palate even with more carbonation than I expected, very satisfying.  The two best things to happen to Wisconsin micros is New Glarus unplugged series and Tyranenas brewers gone wild.

Near black color with a small lid of dark tan bubbles. Looks like a rather silky pour. First sniff certainly does not hold anything back, with big coffee, oatmeal and lightly burnt caramel. While I like coffee, I still have not hopped upon the coffee brew wagon. The aroma does settle to a thick espresso, but still I am not persuaded. Nice smooth feel that is a touch biting in the finish. Caramel malt, start with a abrupt change of pace when the coffee flavors hit mid sip. A return to dark and roasted malts in the finish and linger. For some reason I feel I just dumped some instant coffee into my oatmeal. Coffee and porter/stout lovers will likely rave about this one. For me, a fine brew, but once again, not my cup of joe.

12oz bottle i believe only a few weeks young. pours very dark with nice tan head. nose is gushing with stale coffee left cold over night and undertones of oatmeal. flavor notes of chocolate and oats that quickly evolves into a lot of stale coffee. youd think the taste the stale coffee wouldnt be good but it actually is! the coffee and hops provide quite a bit of bitterness too. mouthfeel is not very thick but full bodied. carbination is a tad high. alcohol is well hidden. this really is a tasty coffee porter but far from perfect.

12 oz bottle sampled from drewbeerme.  The aroma is completely coffee, maybe theres a hint of malt in there but its almost all coffee and stale coffee left on the burner at that.  Mmm, I love it.  Coffee dominates the tongue as well but with some nice sweetness, milkyness, and a little chocolate.  Silky medium thick body, I can really taste and feel all the oats that went into it.  Very nice, Ill have to get some more of this and continue to rerate.
This is full of great coffee flavor!  I had two of my four the first night and I loved it!!

Bottled.  Poured a lovely shade of extra-deep brown with an initial creamy cap of beige head that receded after a couple minutes.  Nose was heavy on the deeply-roasted, excellent coffee blend with sweeter milk chocolate appearing intermittently... coffee steals the show and is damn good!  The flavor department does the aroma justice!... with deeply-roasted coffee disseminating brilliantly across the palate.. and perfectly-aligned oat and milk chocolate sweetness to balance the coffee bitterness.. Slightly oily and heavier-bodied on the palate, with an ideal level of coffee bitterness and a satisfying warm finish.  As an added bonus, I could feel the caffeine kick in after a couple sips!  Magnificent!

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2007 On Tap.  Dark color.  Smell of fresh coffee grounds,  spice, vanilla, malt, chocolate and hints of hops and caramel.  Taste of fresh roasted coffee.  I can actually taste two different coffee beans in my mouth with every sip.  Also can taste coco, malt, hops, milk, little bit of smoke, and hints of caramel.  Nice and creamy and warms your insides up.  Dry, sweet bitterness at the end. Can hardly taste the alcohol and its even better when its warms up.  I love the strong coffee smell and taste.  Much better than Bells Java and Founders Breakfast!  Great job Rob!

From bottle obtained on tapping night. Aroma is a huge mist of coffee bean,somewhat different then other coffee brews,probaly due to use of exotic sumatra and Costa Rican coffee beans,aroma is enhanced with touchs of chocolate cake batter and charcoal,head is virtually non existant, taste is bitter bakers chocolate, vanilla, a touch of maple sweetness all masterly blended with a wonderful and unique coffee flavor,ends with a teasing mild hop finish. Carbonation is low but evident, which along with the oatmeal gives it a creamy slick finish. More medium then full bodied, so you could enjoy more then one at a sitting ;coffee seems to be the flavor of this winter,and this is one of the best. Herr Brewmaster is 5 for 5 in the Brewers Gone Wild series
